qas.question: How many republics was the Kingdom of Macedonia splintered into?
In what year did the Fourt Macedonian War end?
Who did Rome fight in the Fourth Macedonian War?

answers.text: a Macedonian pretender to the throne

qas.question: What effect did the establishment of the kingdom of Macedonia have on Greece?
Who could claim victory at the Second Battle of Pydna?

context: Convinced now that the Greeks (and therefore the rest of the region) would not have peace if left alone, Rome decided to establish its first permanent foothold in the Greek world, and divided the Kingdom of Macedonia into <a0_0>four client republics<a0_0/>. Yet, Macedonian agitation continued. The Fourth Macedonian War, 150 to <a1_0>148 BC<a1_0/>, was fought against <a2_0>a Macedonian pretender to the throne<a2_0/> who was again <a3_0>destabilizing<a3_0/> Greece by trying to re-establish the old kingdom. <a4_0>The Romans<a4_0/> swiftly defeated the Macedonians at the Second battle of Pydna.
